title: Kafka Secured Connection
help:
Kafka Connector

The Kafka connector allows you to access the Kafka Producer API through WSO2 EI and acts as a message producer that facilitates message publishing. The Kafka connector sends messages to the Kafka brokers.

value.name: connectionName
value.helpTip: The name for the kafka connection

value.name: bootstrapServers
value.helpTip: The Kafka brokers listed as host1:port1 and host2:port2.

value.name: keySerializerClass
value.helpTip: The serializer class for the key that implements the serializer interface.

value.name: valueSerializerClass
value.helpTip: The serializer class for the value that implements the serializer interface.

value.name: acks
value.helpTip: The number of acknowledgments that the producer requires for the leader to receive before considering a request to be complete.

value.name: bufferMemory
value.helpTip: The total bytes of memory the producer can use to buffer records waiting to be sent to the server.

value.name: compressionType
value.helpTip: The compression type for the data generated by the producer.

value.name: retries
value.helpTip: Set a value greater than zero if you want the client to resent any records automatically when a request fails.

value.name: batchSize
value.helpTip: Specify how many records the producer should batch together when multiple records are sent to the same partition.

value.name: clientId
value.helpTip: The client identifier that you pass to the server when making requests.

value.name: sslKeyPassword
value.helpTip: The password of the private key in the keystore file. Setting this for the client is optional.

value.name: sslKeystoreLocation
value.helpTip: The location of the key store file. Setting this for the client is optional. Set this when you want to have two-way authentication for the client.

value.name: sslKeystorePassword
value.helpTip: The store password for the keystore file. Setting this for the client is optional. Set it only if ssl.keystore.location is configured.

value.name: sslTruststoreLocation
value.helpTip: The location of the trust store file.

value.name: sslTruststorePassword
value.helpTip: The password for the trust store file.

value.name: lingerTime
value.helpTip: The time, in milliseconds, to wait before sending a record. Set this property when you want the client to reduce the number of requests sent when the load is moderate. This adds a small delay rather than immediately sending out a record. Therefore, the producer waits up to allow other records to be sent so that the requests can be batched together.

value.name: maxBlockTime
value.helpTip: The maximum time in milliseconds that the KafkaProducer.send() and the KafkaProducer.partitionsFor() methods can be blocked.

value.name: maxRequestSize
value.helpTip: The maximum size of a request in bytes.

value.name: partitionerClass
value.helpTip: The partitioner class that implements the partitioner interface.

value.name: receiveBufferBytes
value.helpTip: The size of the TCP receive buffer (SO_RCVBUF) to use when reading data.

value.name: requestTimeout
value.helpTip: The maximum amount of time, in milliseconds, that a client waits for the server to respond.

value.name: timeout
value.helpTip: The maximum amount of time, in milliseconds, that the server waits for the acknowledgments from followers to meet the acknowledgment requirements that the producer has specified with acks configuration.

value.name: maxPoolSize
value.helpTip: The maximum number of message requests that can share the Kafka connection.

value.name: blockOnBufferFull
value.helpTip: Set to true to stop accepting new records when the memory buffer is full. When blocking is not desirable, set this property to false, which causes the producer to throw an exception if a record is sent to the memory buffer when it is full.

value.name: maxInFlightRequestsPerConnection
value.displayName: Max In Flight Requests Per Connection
value.helpTip: The maximum number of unacknowledged requests that the client can send via a single connection before blocking.

value.name: metadataFetchTimeout
value.helpTip: The maximum amount of time, in milliseconds, to block and wait for the metadata fetch to succeed before throwing an exception to the client.

value.name: metadataMaxAge
value.helpTip: The period of time, in milliseconds, after which you should refresh metadata even if there was no partition leadership changes to proactively discover any new brokers or partitions.

value.name: metricReporters
value.helpTip: A list of classes to use as metrics reporters.

value.name: metricsNumSamples
value.helpTip: The number of samples maintained to compute metrics.

value.name: metricsSampleWindow
value.helpTip: The window of time, in milliseconds, that a metrics sample is computed over.

value.name: reconnectBackoff
value.helpTip: The amount of time to wait before attempting to reconnect to a given host.

value.name: retryBackoff
value.helpTip: The amount of time, in milliseconds, to wait before attempting to retry a failed request to a given topic partition.

value.name: saslJaasConfig
value.helpTip: JAAS login context parameters for SASL connections in the format used by JAAS configuration files.

value.name: saslKerberosServiceName
value.helpTip: The Kerberos principal name that Kafka runs as.

value.name: saslKerberosKinitCmd
value.helpTip: The kerberos kinit command path.

value.name: saslKerberosKinitCmd
value.helpTip: The kerberos kinit command path.

value.name: saslKerberosMinTimeBeforeRelogin
value.displayName: SASL Kerberos Min Time Before Relogin
value.helpTip: Login thread's sleep time, in milliseconds, between refresh attempts.

value.name: saslKerberosTicketRenewJitter
value.helpTip: Percentage of random jitter added to the renewal time.

value.name: saslKerberosTicketRenewWindowFactor
value.displayName: SASL Kerberos Ticket Renew Window Factor
value.helpTip: The login thread sleeps until the specified window factor of time from the last refresh to the ticket's expiry is reached, after which it will try to renew the ticket.

value.name: securityProtocol
value.helpTip: The protocol used to communicate with brokers.

value.name: poolingEnabled
value.helpTip: Whether connection pooling is enabled or not.

value.name: maxActiveConnections
value.helpTip: Maximum number of active connections.

value.name: maxIdleConnections
value.helpTip: Maximum number of idle connections.

value.name: maxWaitTime
value.helpTip: Maximum time to wait for a pooled component to become available.

value.name: minEvictionTime
value.helpTip: The minimum amount of time an object may sit idle in the pool before it is eligible for eviction.

value.name: evictionCheckInterval
value.helpTip: The number of milliseconds between runs of the object evictor.

value.name: exhaustedAction
value.helpTip: The behavior of the pool when the pool is exhausted.

value.name: sslEnabledProtocols
value.helpTip: The list of protocols enabled for SSL connections.

value.name: sslKeystoreType
value.helpTip: The format of the keystore file. Setting this for the client is optional.

value.name: sslProtocol
value.helpTip: The SSL protocol used to generate the SSLContext.

value.name: sslProvider
value.helpTip: The name of the security provider used for SSL connections. The default value is the default security provider of the JVM.

value.name: sslTruststoreType
value.helpTip: The format of the trust store file.

value.name: sslCipherSuites
value.helpTip: A list of cipher suites.

value.name: sslEndpointIdentificationAlgorithm
value.helpTip: The endpoint identification algorithm to validate the server hostname using a server certificate.

value.name: sslKeymanagerAlgorithm
value.helpTip: The algorithm used by the key manager factory for SSL connections. The default value is the key manager factory algorithm configured for the Java Virtual Machine.

value.name: sslSecureRandomImplementation
value.helpTip: The SecureRandom PRNG implementation to use for SSL cryptography operations.

value.name: sslTrustmanagerAlgorithm
value.helpTip: The algorithm used by the trust manager factory for SSL connections. The default value is the trust manager factory algorithm configured for the Java Virtual Machine.
